TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BindingsCollection extends System.Windows.Forms.BaseCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Simple data binding is accomplished by adding <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> objects to a BindingsCollection. Any object that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class can access the BindingsCollection through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.DataBindings%2A> property. For a list of Windows controls that support data binding, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> class.
## Examples The following example binds the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Text%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control to a field in a database.
[!code-vb[Classic BindingsCollection Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.b_5_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic BindingsCollection Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.b_5_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic BindingsCollection Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.b_5_1.cpp)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs when you invoke the Clear method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearCore() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the collection of any members.
Occurs when the collection has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the CollectionChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection> named `BindingsCollection1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the CollectionChanged event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#126](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.b_14_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#126](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.b_14_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Occurs when the collection is about to change.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the CollectionChanging event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection> named `BindingsCollection1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the CollectionChanging event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#125](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.b_11_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#125](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.b_11_1.vb)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example prints the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember%2A> value of each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Binding> in a control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection>.
[!code-cpp[Classic BindingsCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.b_16_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[Classic BindingsCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.b_16_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic BindingsCollection.this Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.b_16_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The collection doesn't contain an item at the specified index.

Docs.summary: Gets the bindings in the collection as an object.
Docs.value: An containing all of the collection members.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCollectionChanged(class System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs ccevent) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnCollectionChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnCollectionChanging(class System.ComponentModel.CollectionChangeEventArgs e) cil managed

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingsCollection.CollectionChanging> event occurs when the event is about to change.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnCollectionChanging method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
